poem:
"The Graph of Doom"

Someone graphed out despair
in Barnet's hall of power.
The line of hope is bare,
a flatline in the hour.
Funds dwindle, people grow,
a dance grimly foretold.
The council's concern shows
as the future unfolds.
Demographics ask,
what will become of we?
A question masked
by flatlined certainty.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Barnet council’s ‘Graph of Doom’ now looks prophetic In 2011, two senior council managers in north London put together a PowerPoint graph that they felt might help kick off a useful discussion with colleagues about the future of local government. What would happen, they asked, if town hall funding flatlined, while demographic pressures continued to rise steadily? The answer, they suggested, lay in what became known as the Barnet Graph of Doom. It indicated that". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
